title: Adorable video shows two bear cubs who locked themselves in a van and honked the horn for 20 minutes
text:
Two bear cubs locked themselves into a van and honked the horn repeatedly before being led out by the vehicle’s owner.

Jeff Stokely, who works for a home security company, parked his van outside a customer’s home in Gatlinburg, Tennessee on Friday.

While working inside, he heard someone honking a car horn from outside for about 20 minutes.

Suspecting that it might be his vehicle, he went outside to take a look, WBIR-TV reported.

Two bear cubs locked themselves in a van in Gaitlinburg, Tennessee on Friday

The van belonged to Jeff Stokely, who works for a home security company

He says the cubs likely climbed into the driver's side seat and hit the lock button

What he found was surprising - two small bear cubs had climbed into his van and were unable to get out.

Stokely thought that the bears climbed into the van through the driver’s side door.

Stokely opened the back door of the van, allowing the cubs to wander back into the woods

Fortunately, the momma bear was nowhere in sight while Stokely was around

He believes the cubs then closed the door and hit the lock button while inside.

Stokely then captured the scene on video, showing the bear cubs inside the vehicle.

He then opened the back door to the van. The cubs then climbed out and returned to the woods.

Fortunately for Stokely, the momma bear was nowhere in sight.
description: Jeff Stokely, who works for a home security company, parked his van outside a customer's home in Gatlinburg, Tennessee on Friday. He then noticed something unusual.
